result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marveunta D Jones

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.Defendant 
Marveunta D Jones not in court. 
Case scheduled for 2 pm. and Matter called @ 3:07 pm.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. 
Court orders a warrant be issued.
Bail is revoked and forfeited.
Body ONLY.
Pre-trial conference on October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:56 PM Defendant Marveunta D Jones in court, in custody with Attorney Steven Hughes as a friend of the Court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. 
 Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
